flawed_nl_solution:
At a cost of $12 per bushel, and with 48 apples per bushel, then each apple costs Bronson $12/48=<<12/48=0.3>>0.3
If he sells the apples to the stores at $0.4 per apple, then he makes a profit of $0.4-$0.3=<<0.4-0.3=0.1>>0.1 per apple.
After selling 100 apples to the store, his profit would be 100*$0.1=<<100*0.1=10.28>>10.28.
